message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV. 

This paper proposes a novel mechanism for improving neural machine translation systems, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The proposed mechanism involves additional recurrent layers, which suggests the involvement of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML), making cs.AI and cs.LG (Learning) likely sub-categories as well. The paper also mentions attention models, which are commonly used in NLP and ML, further supporting the likelihood of cs.CL, cs.AI, and cs.LG. Additionally, the paper mentions experimental results, which may involve the use of neural networks, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper may involve image-to-text translation, as the authors mention Chinese-English and German-English translation tasks, which could involve translating text from images, making cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) a possible sub-category.
